item.title: Recent Reading: Charlaine Harris
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Dead in the Family, by Charlaine Harris; copyright 2010 by Charlaine Harris, Inc.; ISBN 978-0-441-02015-7.

    Number 10 in the Sookie Stackhouse series, if I'm counting correctly. A favorite series.

item.title: Recent Reading: Charlaine Harris
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Dead and Gone, by Charlaine Harris; copyright 2009 by Charlaine Harris, Inc.; ISBN 978-0-441-01851-2.

    This is the ninth Sookie Stackhouse novel, if I'm counting correctly.

item.title: Recent Reading: S. L. Wright
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Confessions of a Demon, by S. L. Wright, copyright 2009; ISBN 978-0-451-46232-0.

    This is the first book about Allay, but I read it second.

item.title: Recent Reading: Stacia Kane
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Unholy Ghosts, by Stacia Kane; copyright 2009 by Stacey Fackler; ISBN 978-00345-511557-5.

    The first Chess Putnam novel. I like the paranormal post-apocalypse world of this novel, and the main character's damaged view of things.

item.title: Recent Reading: Karen Chance
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Embrace the Night, by Karen Chance; copyright 2008; ISBN 979-0-451-46199-5.

    The fourth novel in the Cassie Palmer series.

item.title: Recent Reading: Lee Roland
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Viper Moon, by Lee Roland, copyright 2011 by Margie Lee Roland; ISBN 978-0-451-23376-9.

    A novel of the Earth Witches.

    I'd have liked some more with these characters.

item.title: Recent Reading: Faith Hunter
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Skinwalker, by Faith Hunter, copyright 2009; ISBN 978-0-451-46280-0.

    The 1st Jane Yellowrock novel.

    I really enjoyed this one.

item.title: Recent Reading: Jeaniene Frost
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Halfway to the Grave, by Jeaniene Frost, copyright 2007; ISBN 978-0-06-124508-4.

    The first in the Night Huntress series; the main character is Cat Crawfield.

  • One Foot in the Grave, by Jeaniene Frost, copyright 2008; ISBN 978-0-06-124509-1.

    The second in the Night Huntress.

item.title: Recent Reading: Patricia A. McKillip
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• The Forgotten Beasts of Eld, by Patricia A. McKillip, copyright 1974; ISBN 0-425-06595-2.

    This was the first book by Patricia A. McKillip that I remember reading, I think, and though it was The Riddlemaster of Hed that really confirmed McKillip as my favorite author at the time, this book certainly contributed to my liking. I find McKillip's writing lyrical and her settings evocative.

item.title: Recent Reading: Eluki Bes Shahar
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
• Hellflower, by Eluki bes Shahar, copyright 1991; ISBN 0-88677-475-6.

    Book 1 of the Hellflower series, featuring one of my favorite characters, Butterflies are Free St. Cyr, guilty of one of the most heinous crimes in the galaxy: being a Librarian.

  • Darktraders, by Eluki bes Shahar, copyright 1992; ISBN 0-88677-507-8.

    Book 2 of the Hellflower series.

  • Archangel Blues, by Eluki bes Shahar, copyright 1993; ISBN 0-88677-543-4.
